font-family-desc.name: font-family
font-family-desc.summary: The font-family CSS descriptor allows authors to specify the font family for the font specified in an @font-face rule.
font-family-desc.title: font-family

font-prop-desc.name: font-stretch
font-prop-desc.summary: The font-stretch CSS descriptor allows authors to specify a normal, condensed, or expanded face for the fonts specified in the @font-face rule.
font-prop-desc.title: font-stretch

font-prop-desc.name: font-style
font-prop-desc.summary: The font-style CSS descriptor allows authors to specify font styles for the fonts specified in the @font-face rule.
font-prop-desc.title: font-style

font-prop-desc.name: font-weight
font-prop-desc.summary: The font-weight CSS descriptor allows authors to specify font weights for the fonts specified in the @font-face rule. The font-weight property can separately be used to set how thick or thin characters in text should be displayed.
font-prop-desc.title: font-weight

src-desc.name: src
src-desc.summary: The src CSS descriptor of the @font-face rule specifies the resource containing font data. It is required for the @font-face rule to be valid.
src-desc.title: src

unicode-range-desc.name: unicode-range
unicode-range-desc.summary: The unicode-range CSS descriptor sets the specific range of characters to be used from a font defined by @font-face and made available for use on the current page. If the page doesn't use any character in this range, the font is not downloaded; if it uses at least one, the whole font is downloaded.
unicode-range-desc.title: unicode-range

font-face-rule.name: font-face
font-face-rule.summary: The @font-face CSS at-rule specifies a custom font with which to display text; the font can be loaded from either a remote server or a locally-installed font on the user's own computer.
font-face-rule.title: @font-face

font-family-prop.name: font-family
font-family-prop.summary: The font-family CSS property specifies a prioritized list of one or more font family names and/or generic family names for the selected element.

firefox.notes: Not supported on option elements. See bug 1536148.

font-family-prop.title: font-family

font-family-prop.name: font-family
font-family-prop.summary: The font-family attribute indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names.
font-family-prop.title: font-family

propdef-font-feature-settings.name: font-feature-settings
propdef-font-feature-settings.summary: The font-feature-settings CSS property controls advanced typographic features in OpenType fonts.

firefox.notes: The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition suggests using the ssty feature to provide glyph variants more suitable for use in scripts (for example primes used as superscripts). Starting with Firefox 29, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition also suggests applying the dtls feature to letters when placing mathematical accents to get dotless forms (for example dotless i, j with a hat). Starting with Firefox 35, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. You can override the default values determined by the MathML rendering engine with CSS.
From Firefox 4 to Firefox 14 (inclusive), Firefox supported an older, slightly different syntax. See OpenType Font Feature support in Firefox 4.

firefox_android.notes: The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition suggests using the ssty feature to provide glyph variants more suitable for use in scripts (for example primes used as superscripts). Starting with Firefox 29, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. The ISO/IEC CD 14496-22 3rd edition also suggests applying the dtls feature to letters when placing mathematical accents to get dotless forms (for example dotless i, j with a hat). Starting with Firefox 35, this is done automatically by the MathML rendering engine. You can override the default values determined by the MathML rendering engine with CSS.
From Firefox 4 to Firefox 14 (inclusive), Firefox supported an older, slightly different syntax. See OpenType Font Feature support in Firefox 4.

propdef-font-feature-settings.title: font-feature-settings

propdef-font-kerning.name: font-kerning
propdef-font-kerning.summary: The font-kerning CSS property sets the use of the kerning information stored in a font.
propdef-font-kerning.title: font-kerning

propdef-font-size-adjust.name: font-size-adjust
propdef-font-size-adjust.summary: The font-size-adjust CSS property sets the size of lower-case letters relative to the current font size (which defines the size of upper-case letters).

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 40, font-size-adjust: 0 was incorrectly interpreted as font-size-adjust: none (bug 1144885).
Before Firefox 3, font-size-adjust was supported on Windows only.

propdef-font-size-adjust.title: font-size-adjust

font-size-prop.name: font-size
font-size-prop.summary: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.
font-size-prop.title: font-size

font-size-prop.name: font-size
font-size-prop.summary: The font-size attribute refers to the size of the font from baseline to baseline when multiple lines of text are set solid in a multiline layout environment.
font-size-prop.title: font-size

propdef-font-stretch.name: font-stretch
propdef-font-stretch.summary: The font-stretch CSS property selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font.

chrome.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

chrome_android.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

opera.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

opera_android.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

samsunginternet_android.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

webview_android.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

edge_blink.notes: A font-stretch definition must be added to the @font-face before this property will function.

propdef-font-stretch.title: font-stretch

propdef-font-stretch.name: font-stretch
propdef-font-stretch.summary: The font-stretch attribute indicates the desired amount of condensing or expansion in the glyphs used to render the text.
propdef-font-stretch.title: font-stretch

font-style-prop.name: font-style
font-style-prop.summary: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 44, oblique was not distinguished from italic.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox 44, oblique was not distinguished from italic.

font-style-prop.title: font-style

font-style-prop.name: font-style
font-style-prop.summary: The font-style attribute specifies whether the text is to be rendered using a normal, italic, or oblique face.
font-style-prop.title: font-style

propdef-font-synthesis.name: font-synthesis
propdef-font-synthesis.summary: The font-synthesis CSS property controls which missing typefaces, bold or italic, may be synthesized by the browser.
propdef-font-synthesis.title: font-synthesis

propdef-font-variant-caps.name: font-variant-caps
propdef-font-variant-caps.summary: The font-variant-caps CSS property controls the use of alternate glyphs for capital letters.
propdef-font-variant-caps.title: font-variant-caps

propdef-font-variant-east-asian.name: font-variant-east-asian
propdef-font-variant-east-asian.summary: The font-variant-east-asian CSS property controls the use of alternate glyphs for East Asian scripts, like Japanese and Chinese.
propdef-font-variant-east-asian.title: font-variant-east-asian

propdef-font-variant-ligatures.name: font-variant-ligatures
propdef-font-variant-ligatures.summary: The font-variant-ligatures CSS property controls which ligatures and contextual forms are used in textual content of the elements it applies to.
propdef-font-variant-ligatures.title: font-variant-ligatures

propdef-font-variant-numeric.name: font-variant-numeric
propdef-font-variant-numeric.summary: The font-variant-numeric CSS property controls the usage of alternate glyphs for numbers, fractions, and ordinal markers.
propdef-font-variant-numeric.title: font-variant-numeric

propdef-font-variant-position.name: font-variant-position
propdef-font-variant-position.summary: The font-variant-position CSS property controls the use of alternate, smaller glyphs that are positioned as superscript or subscript.
propdef-font-variant-position.title: font-variant-position

propdef-font-variant.name: font-variant
propdef-font-variant.summary: The font-variant CSS shorthand property allows you to set all the font variants for a font.
propdef-font-variant.title: font-variant

font-weight-prop.name: font-weight
font-weight-prop.summary: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.
font-weight-prop.title: font-weight

font-weight-prop.name: font-weight
font-weight-prop.summary: The font-weight attribute refers to the boldness or lightness of the glyphs used to render the text, relative to other fonts in the same font family.
font-weight-prop.title: font-weight

font-prop.name: font
font-prop.summary: The font CSS shorthand property sets all the different properties of an element's font. Alternatively, it sets an element's font to a system font.
font-prop.title: font

font-size-adjust-prop.name: font-size-adjust
font-size-adjust-prop.summary: The font-size-adjust attribute allows authors to specify an aspect value for an element that will preserve the x-height of the first choice font in a substitute font.
font-size-adjust-prop.title: font-size-adjust

font-variant-prop.name: font-variant
font-variant-prop.summary: The font-variant attribute indicates whether the text is to be rendered using variations of the fontʼs glyphs.
font-variant-prop.title: font-variant
